bug.description:
Hello, Currently, it is not possible to set the seed for numpy and torch if the env doesn't have a seed method.
ray/rllib/evaluation/rollout_worker.py
Lines 379 to 391 in 5d5643e
# set numpy and python seed
if seed is not None:
np.random.seed(seed)
random.seed(seed)
if not hasattr(self.env, "seed"):
raise ValueError("Env doesn't support env.seed(): {}".format(
self.env))
self.env.seed(seed)
try:
assert torch is not None
torch.manual_seed(seed)
except AssertionError:
logger.info("Could not seed torch")
(This issue doesn't affect tensorflow.) Also, why is the seed method not part of the BaseEnvs like in gym? Thanks
